Wisdom: الْمَخْذُولُ مَنْ [كَانَتْ‏] لَهُ إِلَى اللِّئَامِ حَاجَةٌ
enWisdom: The forsaken is he who has to ask for something from the ignoble

Wisdom: أَصْعَبُ الْمَرَامِ طَلَبُ مَا فِي أَيْدِي اللِّئَامِ
enWisdom: The most difficult objective is seeking that which is in the possession of the vile ones

Wisdom: بَذْلُ الْوَجْهِ إِلَى اللِّئَامِ الْمَوْتُ الْأَكْبَرُ
enWisdom: Sacrificing one’s dignity in front of the wicked is the greatest death

Wisdom: رَضِيَ بِالْحِرْمَانِ طَالِبُ الرِّزْقِ مِنَ اللِّئَامِ
enWisdom: He who seeks sustenance from the wicked has accepted deprivation
The one who seeks good from vile people is deprived of it

Wisdom: فَوْتُ الْحَاجَةِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ طَلَبِهَا مِنْ غَيْرِ أَهْلِهَا
enWisdom: Not having your needs fulfilled is better than seeking them from those who are not worthy
One who seeks help from the lowly is abased
When you express your needs to someone, you abase yourself before him

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَعَانَ بِعَدُوِّهِ عَلَى حَاجَتِهِ ازْدَادَ بُعْداً مِنْهَا
enWisdom: Whoever seeks the assistance of his enemy in order to fulfil his need, increases his distance from it [instead of getting it]

Wisdom: مَنْ كَانَتْ لَهُ إِلَى اللِّئَامِ حَاجَةٌ فَقَدْ خَذَلَ
enWisdom: One who needs something from the vile ones has indeed been forsaken

Wisdom: مِنْ أَعْظَمِ مَصَايِبِ الْأَخْيَارِ حَاجَتُهُمْ إِلَى مُدَارَاةِ الْأَشْرَارِ
enWisdom: One of the greatest hardships for the virtuous is having to socialize with the wicked

Wisdom: لَا شَيْ‏ءَ أَوْجَعُ مِنَ الِاضْطِرَارِ إِلَى مَسْأَلَةِ الْأَغْمَارِ
enWisdom: There is nothing more tormenting than having to ask from the ignorant out of desperation
